title: FASTag on a slow track: how the tussle over MDR revenues stonewalled the electronic-tolling project
text:
It took nine long years, two governments, and two committees to make electronic toll collections on India’s highways a reality. Muddled priorities delayed the FASTag project endlessly, as private-sector banks and public-sector entities sparred on the revenue model, unable to find a middle ground. It’s still a long road ahead. An ET Prime exclusive.

Union minister for road transport and highways Nitin Gadkari (centre) during the exchange of agreements at a conference titled ‘One Nation One FASTag’ in New Delhi
